alert.note: Alert for Lebanon; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:17PM EST until January 11 at 12:37PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern affecting Schuylkill and Lebanon Counties. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt will contribute to rising river levels along Swatara Creek through Thursday. Additional rainfall Friday into Saturday will result in additional rises through the weekend. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown, Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Several driveways and other minor roadways are affected. Water begins to enter some basements. At 10.0 feet, High water isolates several houses. At 12.0 feet, A number of secondary roads are closed, resulting in some evacuations. A few homes are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Wednesday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 8.5 feet Saturday evening. The river will rise and approach flood stage once again during the day on Saturday. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 02/04/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
